page.title: 04ST.LAURENCE'S CHURCH
page.content: The church was built about 1150 A.D.It forms the centre of the old agricultural village.The parish has 6000 parishoners.There are seats for 220 people.Only about 40 people attend church on a Sunday. 20 people are in the choir and 30 children attend Sunday School.A Youth Club and a Boys and Girls Brigade are attached to the church.Most weddings are between May and September.Money is raised weekly by an envelope system,gifts,appeals and a Spring Fayre.Food is distributed into the community at Harvest time.There are 280 tombstones in the graveyard which is no longer used as the cemetry. There are some broken windows and some graffiti written on a wall.
